summary: This document is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff regarding draft press remarks and Q&A preparation for a potential press conference related to the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses keeping remarks conservative and tethered to the indictment language.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office staff (likely prosecutor or spokesperson)
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who will be conservative regarding press remarks beyond the indictment language.

events.title: Preparation for Maxwell press conference
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff exchange emails drafting press remarks and Q&A in preparation for a potential press conference regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's indictment.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing press materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell's indictment in June 2020.
Staff aimed to keep public remarks conservative and closely aligned with the language of the indictment.
The email exchange indicates coordination for a potential press conference regarding the Maxwell case.
